snp5.7:1.3: “I am not able to cross the great flood.
snp5.7:1.5: depending on which I may cross this flood.”
snp5.7:2.3: depending on the perception ‘there is nothing’, <j>cross the flood.
snp5.7:2.4: Giving up sensual pleasures, <j>refraining from chatter,
snp5.7:2.5: watch day and night for the ending of craving.”
snp5.7:3.1: “One who is free of desire for sensual pleasuress,”
snp5.7:3.3: “depending on nothingness, all else left behind,
snp5.7:3.4: freed in the ultimate liberation of perception:
snp5.7:3.5: might they remain there without travelling on?”
snp5.7:4.1: “One free of desire for sensual pleasuress,”
snp5.7:4.3: “depending on nothingness, all else left behind,
snp5.7:4.4: freed in the ultimate liberation of perception:
snp5.7:4.5: they might remain there without travelling on.”
snp5.7:5.1: “If they were to remain there without travelling on,
snp5.7:5.3: and, being freed, were to grow cool right there,
snp5.7:5.4: would the consciousness of that sort pass away?”
snp5.7:6.1: “As a flame tossed by a gust of wind,”
snp5.7:6.3: “comes to an end and cannot be reckoned;
snp5.7:6.4: so too, a sage freed from the set of mental phenomena
snp5.7:6.5: comes to an end and cannot be reckoned.”
snp5.7:7.1: “One who has disappeared—do they not exist?
snp5.7:7.2: Or are they free from disease for eternity?
snp5.7:7.4: for truly you understand this matter.”
snp5.7:8.1: “One who has disappeared cannot be defined,”
snp5.7:8.3: “They have nothing <j>by which others might describe them.
snp5.7:8.4: When all things have been eradicated,
snp5.7:8.5: eradicated, too, are all ways of speech.”
